titlestmt.titleproper: Marcia Moss Lewis genealogical research materials undated
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Marcia Moss Lewis genealogical research materials
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: Marcia Moss Lewis (Mrs. George C.) was a professional genealogist who verified information on applicants to various patriotic societies. She lived in Bryn Mawr, Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.p: The collection is comprised of spiral notebooks and other notes of genealogical research on various families, including Eichelberger, Miller, Evans, and many others. The notes are from published sources, and primary sources such as deeds and wills. The information pertains primarily to 18th and 19th century people, mostly from Pennsylvania, although there are other states represented. There are also some notes on how to conduct genealogical research.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
